intro: Asterocephalus lucidus var. hladnikiana, commonly known as the Hladnik's starhead, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped inflorescences that bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant has elongated, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in mountainous forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
